**The Yellow Book of Shangqing Rites for Crossing Over**

**Scripture Title:** *The Yellow Book of Shangqing Rites for Crossing Over*. Author unknown, approximately dating to the Northern and Southern Dynasties. A ritual manual for bedroom cultivation practices in the early Heavenly Master Dao tradition. One scroll. Base text from *Daoist Canon of the Zhengtong Era*, Orthodox Section, Part One.

---

**The Yellow Book of Shangqing Rites for Crossing Over**

When disciples receive the Dao under a master’s guidance, they must not exceed twenty years of age for the Crossing Over; if they receive the Dao beyond twenty, it is considered an overstepping, and they must bathe, observe prohibitions, and burn incense. Upon entering the oratory (*jing*), they must first report to the master before proceeding. Upon entering and exiting, they bow to the oratory and express gratitude.

**Entering the Oratory**
For the first entry into the oratory, the yang disciple stands at the *yin* position (north), and the yin disciple stands at the *shen* position (west). The one seeking the Crossing Over kneels and says: *"I, a mortal of flesh, am fortunate beyond a thousand generations to have been touched by the transformative power of the Dao. Having sought the Dharma for some time yet remaining uninitiated into the Crossing Over, I bow my head in reverence and take refuge, begging for the gift of life."* They then bow twice.

The master responds: *"Today is auspicious; it is fitting to serve as your bridge."*

The seeker repeats: *"I humbly pray for its fulfillment."*

The master replies: *"I shall make the announcement."* The disciple, overwhelmed by the grace received, bows twice more to the master, who then takes their hand and leads them to face east.

**Visualizing the Officials and Soldiers**
Both stand facing east, the yang on the left and the yin on the right, hands clasped together. The yang disciple interlocks fingers, with the second finger inserted between the yin disciple’s second and third fingers. Each sounds the drum twelve times in their mind, visualizing the Registrar Officials and Envoys, Generals, and Soldiers from the talismans they wear. These figures are adorned in resplendent robes, arrayed in ranks, guarding the disciples front and back, left and right. They are to summon the life-generating *qi* of the four directions to dispel calamities and disperse misfortune, reporting and distinguishing matters with clarity.

This visualization is performed once and then concluded.

**Visualizing the White Qi**
Each visualizes a white *qi* from the cinnabar field (*dantian*), as large as a six-inch mirror, emerging between the eyebrows. It gradually expands, radiating brilliance that illuminates the head above and showers the body below, penetrating to reveal the five viscera, six bowels, nine palaces, twelve chambers, four limbs, five constituents, joints, sinews, vessels, pores, and defensive and constructive *qi*—both exterior and interior—all becoming luminously clear.

This visualization is performed once and then concluded.

**Visualizing the Royal Qi**
Each visualizes the royal *qi* according to the season:
- In spring, visualize the green *qi* of the east nourishing the body, accompanied by red *qi*.
- In summer, visualize the red *qi* of the south, accompanied by yellow *qi*.
- In autumn, visualize the white *qi* of the west, accompanied by black *qi*.
- In winter, visualize the black *qi* of the north, accompanied by green *qi*.
- During the four seasons, visualize the yellow *qi* of the center, accompanied by white *qi*.

Tilt the head back to inhale the *qi* through the nose, then lower the head to swallow it, guiding it down to the cinnabar field. From there, it ascends to the Kunlun (head). This is done three times, with three swallowings, and then concluded.

**Swallowing the Three Palaces**
Each visualizes the life-generating *qi* of the Three Origins descending in pure whiteness, enveloping the body. Tilting the head back, they inhale the life-generating *qi* through the nose and say: *"Palace of Heavenly One, may the life-generating *qi* come to enliven me."* Lowering the head, they swallow it, filling the lower cinnabar field, then guiding it upward to the Mud Pill (head). Following the method of Heaven, Earth, and Water, they recite the incantation and swallow. Tilting the head back again, they inhale the life-generating *qi* of the Three Palaces—Heaven, Earth, and Water—through the nose, saying: *"May the life-generating *qi* of the Three Palaces come together to enliven my body."* Lowering the head, they swallow it, filling the lower cinnabar field, then guiding it upward to the Mud Pill. The life-generating *qi* of the Three Palaces, vast and pure white, covers the body and permeates the five viscera, six bowels, and the twelve branches and trunks.

This visualization is performed once and then concluded.

**Initiating the Rite**

The Sixth Rite proceeds with all facing east in a long kneel, each sounding the drum twelve times. The functionary of my body, the *li* officials, emerge—from the Upper Transcendent and Upper Numinous Bureaus—along with the direct envoys of the Orthodox Unity, the *yin-yang* life-generating *qi*, the functionaries for healing maladies, the left and right officials, and the *yin-yang* divine *yu* scribes, two in number. Those who emerge don their solemn attire and stand before and behind me, all receiving the words from my mouth. They are to distinguish and relay the following to the relevant commanderies, counties, townships, and hamlets:

The Central Perfected Officials infuse *qi* and summon all the Lords, Generals, and *li* officials. The Four Beginnings stand vigilant, monitoring the four directions. All officials, lords, and generals who preside over the summons—with reverence, I humbly address:

The Supreme Non-Ultimate Great Dao, the Most High Mysterious Elder, the Lords, Generals, and *li* officials of the Three *Qi*;
The Most High Lord Lao, the Most High Elder, and all Lords, Generals, and *li* officials;
The life-generating *qi* of the Three Masters—Celestial Master, Lineage Master, and Female Master—and their disciples;
All Lords, Generals, and *li* officials;
The Perfected Lords and Generals;
The Lords and Generals of Supreme Harmony;
The Lords and Generals of the Yellow Writ and the Contract of the Abdominal Eye;
The Nine *Qi* Elders and the Lords and Generals of Summons;
The Lords and Generals of *Yin-Yang* Life-Generating *Qi* and Dao Transmission;
The Central Womb Perfected and the Lords and Generals of Preparation;
The Central Womb Red-and-White and the Lords and Generals of Discharge;
The Central Yellow *Wu-Ji* and the Lords and Generals of the Hundred Joints;
The *Yin-Yang* Functionaries and the Lords and Generals of Transformation;
The *Yin-Yang* Perfected *Qi* and the Lords and Generals of Transcendent Dao;
The Lords and Generals of Internal and External Supervision and Enlightenment;
The Lords and Generals of Disaster Dispersion, Calamity Dissolution, and Tribulation Resolution;
The Heavenly, Earthly, and Human Standards, the Three Pennants, and the Four Seasons and Eight Nodes;
The Five Phases and the Union of the Three and Five, the Functionaries of the Dipper’s Handle, and the Lords and Generals;
The Lords and Generals of the Three Officials—Heaven, Earth, and Water—summoning all officials;
The Lords and Generals of this hamlet and encampment, and the transforming spirits within;
The Lords and Generals of the One Hundred Twenty *Qi* and the Former *Qi*;
The Lords and Generals of Ghosts and Bandits.

I, [Name], prostrate in awe and trepidation, declare: I, in my foolishness and ignorance, delight in the Dao and cherish life. Previously, under the guidance of Master [Name], Libationer of *Qi* Cultivation and Perfected One, I received the essential teachings and the Eightfold Great Salvation Method. Bound by duty, I now uphold them.

There is a man/woman of [Commandery], [County], [Township], [Hamlet], named [Name], aged [Age] years, who delights in the Dao and aspires to transcendence. They have come before me seeking passage and salvation, vowing to practice the *yin-yang*, Five Phases, and Three *Qi*. Beginning with the Middle Prime’s first generation, then the Upper Prime’s first generation, and the Lower Prime’s first generation, the Three *Qi* intertwine to form the Dao.

I humbly beseech the Lords and *li* officials of Internal and External Supervision and Enlightenment, the Lords and *li* officials of Spirit Restoration and *Qi* Replenishment, the Lords and Generals of the Encampment’s Transforming Spirits, and the Lords and Generals of the Three Officials—Heaven, Earth, and Water—to act on my behalf and [Name]’s, absolving us of the Three Officials’ judgments, expunging our names from the Registers of Death, and inscribing them in the Register of Long Life under the King. May we be counted among the Seed People.

May my spirit and that of [Name] be steadfast and our life-generating *qi* firm, suffusing our four limbs and five viscera, free from harm. May our desires be fulfilled, our passages secured, our slander silenced, our tasks completed, and our words efficacious. May we not betray the trust placed in us.

I, [Name], prostrate in utmost reverence, kowtow twice and humbly submit this petition, awaiting your response and compliance.

[Clan affiliation to be specified]
[Supreme Purity to be invoked]

May the Year Star [to be specified] and the Earthly Net—on the seventh traversal of the Earthly Net’s three crossings, the first crossing to the left, the Supreme Center crossing to the right, the Mysterious Elder and the Most High joining hands—O Merciful Father and Holy Mother, release us from the snares, remove our names from the Registers of Death, and inscribe them in the Register of Life.

May the Heavenly Net—on the threefold release of the Heavenly Net, first in the Supreme Center to the right of the Mysterious Elder, then the Most High facing and joining hands—he who gave me life be Jiazi, Master Wang Wenqing, Father Kang; she who nurtured me be Jiawu, Master Wei Shangqing, Mother Niu, who bore me and sustained me, their deeds rooted in the Great Dao, together with my parents.

For the Eighth Rite, the Homage to the Four Venerables: cross both hands and raise them toward the *yin* direction, bow once, then kneel in full prostration. Declare: “Jiayin, Radiant Writ of the Dao, the Dao-Father praises and extends his grace, appointing [Name] as your servant, to dispel the great calamities of the world.” The Master says: “Let there be a man or woman born [Name], who through your servant seeks passage and deliverance.”

The disciple says: “Your servant now through Master [Name] seeks passage, that we may together uphold and practice the Dao and its virtue, beseeching harmony in the hidden viscera and the free flow of life-generating *qi* within your servant’s body. May the spirit be steadfast and firm, each free from harm.” Then turn toward the *shen* direction and declare: “Jiashen, Hu Wen, the Long Dao, the Mother who subdues the rebellious and restrains the violent—dispel for your servant the eight disasters of the eight directions on earth.”

Then turn toward the *zi* direction and declare: “Jiazi, Wang Wenqing, Master Father Kang of the Xia Hall—dispel for your servant the great calamities of the world.”

Then turn toward the *wu* direction and declare: “Jiawu, Wei Shangqing, Master Mother Niu—dispel for your servant the eight disasters of the eight directions on earth.”

The incantation follows the same form as that for the *yin* direction, once only.

For the Ninth Rite, Visualization: sit facing the *yang-yin* direction, with the *yin-shen* direction above. Those seeking deliverance place their knees outward, hands joined in the *yin* position and drawn back, palms covering the knees in the *yang* position, fingers interlaced and covering. Tap the teeth twelve times. Visualize the Supreme Black, the True Azure *qi* of the Mysterious Elder; the True Yellow *qi* of the Most High; the True White and the Three Blacks, all merging into a single state of primordial chaos, resembling a fledgling parrot, its five colors blending into yellow, descending into the Cinnabar Field.

Thus, once only.

The Ten Spirits.

The Tenth Visualization: The Ten Spirits of *Jia-zi* and *Jia-wu*

First visualize *Jia-wu*: Wei Shangqing of *Yi-wei*; Du Zhongyang of *Bing-shen*; Zhu Bozhong of *Ding-you*; Zang Wengong of *Wu-xu*; Fan Shaoqing of *Jia-zi*; Wang Wenqing of *Yi-chou*; Long Jiqing of *Bing-yin*; Zhang Zhongqing of *Ding-mao*; Sima Qing of *Wu-chen*; Ji Chuqing. May these ten spirits ascend to the Upper Three Heavenly Courts.

The master declares: “Now there is a man or woman born under such-and-such a name, who entreats me for deliverance.”

The disciple responds: “Your disciple now entreats Master So-and-so for deliverance, that we may together practice the Dao and its virtue, entreating the harmony of *yin* and *yang*, that the *qi* of life may flow through this disciple’s body, that spirit and essence may be concentrated and firm, each free from harm. May the name be struck from the register of death and inscribed in the Jade Record of Longevity, that the nine calamities be transcended, and this disciple be made a seed-person of future generations.”

First visualize from *Jia-zi* to *Wu-chen*, then from *Jia-wu* to *Wu-xu*.

Matching *Jia*
The Eleventh: Matching the Twelve Honorable Names

*Jia-yin*: Mingwenzhang, the Dao-Father who praises and extends the ten;
*Jia-shen*: Hu Wenchang, the Dao-Mother who expounds and subdues the ten.

The master declares: “Now there is a man or woman born under such-and-such a name, who entreats me for deliverance.”

The disciple responds: “Your disciple now entreats Master So-and-so for deliverance, that we may together practice the Dao and its virtue, entreating the harmony of *yin* and *yang*, that the *qi* of life may flow through this disciple’s body, that the register of death be struck and the name inscribed in the Jade Record of Longevity, that the nine calamities be transcended, and this disciple be made a seed-person of future generations.”

Next invoke:
*Jia-zi* Wang Wenqing, the Master-Father Kang;
*Jia-wu* Wei Shangqing, the Master-Mother *Niū-nǎi* (cut as *chǒu*);
*Yi-hai* Pang Mingxin, the Dao-Father Qi Dian Tuo;
*Yi-si* Tang Wenqing, the Dao-Mother *Mǐn* (门+也, cut as *bà*);
*Yi-mao* Dai Gongyang, the Dao-Father Qi Qizhi;
*Yi-you* Kong Ligong, the Dao-Mother *Mā* (慈卒/慈律, cut as *cù/lǜ*);
*Jia-chen* Meng Feiqing, the Dao-Father Chu Zhi Zao Dongshi;
*Jia-xu* Zhan Zijiang, the Dao-Mother *Xì* (女+恚, cut as *zhì-yù*);
*Yi-chou* Long Jiqing, the Dao-Father *Qìe* (加+手) Ning Qi Nanwei;
*Yi-wei* Du Zhongyang, the Dao-Mother *Shī*.

The Five Spirits
The Twelfth Visualization: The Five Spirits

The Spirit of the Great Year, the Spirit of the Current Month, the Spirit of One’s Original Destiny, the Spirit of the Year of Age, the Spirit of the Present Day. May these five spirits ascend to the Three Heavenly Courts.

The master declares: “Now there is a man or woman born under such-and-such a name, who entreats me for deliverance.”

The disciple responds: “Your disciple now entreats Master So-and-so for deliverance, that we may together practice the Dao and its virtue, that the Three Officials’ investigations be resolved, the net of entanglements undone, the register of death struck, the name inscribed in the Jade Record of Longevity, the nine calamities transcended, and this disciple be made a seed-person of future generations.”

Thus, twice only.

The Eight Generations
The Thirteenth: Unbinding the Hands and the Eight Generations

First: Play of the Dragon and Tiger
Left: the Supreme Center; Right: the Mysterious Elder, the Most High.
“This disciple now delivers the man or woman born under such-and-such a name, that we may together practice the Dao and its virtue, entreating the *yin* and *yang* *qi* of life to be born within this disciple, resolving the Three Officials’ investigations, undoing the net of entanglements, striking the register of death, inscribing the name in the Jade Record of Longevity, transcending the nine calamities, and making this disciple a seed-person of future generations.”

Second: Turning the Pass
Left: the Supreme Center; Right: the Mysterious Elder, the Most High.
The newly emerged Lord Lao, the Supreme Clarity of the Primordial Mystery, the Great Dao of the Boundless Upper Three Heavens.

Third: Dragon and Tiger in Union
Left: the Supreme Center; Right: the Mysterious Elder, the Most High.
Lord Lao, the Most High, the Venerable Lord of the Three *Qi*.

Fourth: Dragon and Tiger in Alignment
Left: the Supreme Center; Right: the Mysterious Elder, the Most High.
The Lord Emperor of the Most High, the Heavenly Emperor, the Venerable Lord.

Fifth: Dragon and Tiger in Motion
Left: the Supreme Center; Right: the Mysterious Elder, the Most High.
The Nine Elders of the Most High, the Lords of the Immortal Capital, the Nine *Qi* Venerable Lords, and the like.

Sixth: Dragon and Tiger in Flux
Take the Upper Primordial: Left, the Supreme Center; Right, the Mysterious Elder, the Most High.
Take the Upper Primordial: the Most High, the myriad layers of the Dao’s *qi*, the twelve hundred Lords Official.

Seventh: Dragon and Tiger in Expansion
Take the Upper Primordial: Left, the Supreme Center; Right, the Mysterious Elder, the Most High.
Take the Upper Primordial: the Most High, the Lord of the Supreme Clarity of the Dao, the Venerable Lord of the Supreme Clarity beneath the Jade Steps.

Eighth: Bowing to the Perfected
Take the Upper Primordial: Left, the Supreme; Center, the Mysterious Elder, the Most High.
Take the Upper Primordial: the Most High, the Heavenly Master, the Lineage Master, the Master of the System, the Female Master.

For the Unbinding of the Middle Primordial’s Twenty-Four *Qi*, all declare:
“Now there is such-and-such a name who entreats for deliverance, that we may together practice the Dao and its virtue, entreating the *yin* and *yang* *qi* of life to be born within this disciple’s body, resolving the Three Officials’ investigations, undoing the net of entanglements, striking the register of death, inscribing the name in the Jade Record of Longevity, transcending the nine calamities, and making this disciple a seed-person of future generations.” All is complete.

Unbinding Knots and Taking Nourishment
The master unbinds the knots of the disciple’s sash and loosens the hair; the one making the declaration also unbinds the knots of the worthy one.

The Fourteenth: Method of Ingesting Life and Expelling Death
Men to the left, women to the right. Hands interlaced, both facing the direction of the king, legs extended in seated posture. With the nose, gently draw in the *qi* of life, lower the head and swallow it. Lie down with eyes closed, and with the mouth gently expel the *qi* of death. Three times lying down, three times sitting—stop.

The Nine Palaces
The Fifteenth: Method of Arranging the Nine Palaces

At the head, *wu*, where Heaven and Earth meet: horizontal lines form *yi*, vertical lines form *jia*.

First: *Zi* Nine
*Yang* proceeds to the Lower Primordial’s four; *yin* proceeds to five. Together call: *Zi* Nine.

Second: *Wu* Nine
*Yang* proceeds to the Upper Primordial’s four; *yin* proceeds to five. Together call: *Wu* Nine.

Third: *Mao* Nine
*Yang*: with the left hand, cover the four fingers horizontally, concealing the *yin*; the right hand’s five fingers above. Combined as nine, placed in the eastern direction. Together declare: *Mao* Nine.

Fourth: *You* Nine
*Yin*: left hand upturned with five fingers extended; *yang*: right hand covering with four fingers, horizontally over the *yin* fingers. Placed in the western direction. Together declare: *You* Nine.

Fifth: Central Nine
Heaven covers, Earth bears. *Yang* contemplates the four viscera: liver, heart, lungs, spleen; *yin* contemplates the five viscera: liver, heart, spleen, lungs, kidneys. Combined as nine, together declare: the Central Five-Nine Position is complete.

Together declare: "Water flows to its end." Divide eight to *chou*. *Yang* uses the second toe of the left foot; *yin* uses the five toes of the right foot. Further, with the right hand’s one finger beside the foot, the *yang* finger covers the *yin* toes to make eight. Place at *chou*, together declare: *Gen* Eight Returns, becomes *Kan* One. *Yin* and *yang* together declare *Kan* One.

Next command: "Wood falls to return to its root." Divide six to *hai*. Pure *yang*: right foot and hand each combine three to make six, covering the *yin* left foot. Place at *hai*, declare *Qian* Six Returns, becomes *Zhen* Three. *Yang* uses the left hand’s one finger to horizontally cover the *yin* right hand’s two fingers. Place together at *mao*, aligning with the waist, declare *Zhen* Three.

Next command: "Metal is firm, fire is strong." Divide two to *wei*. Pure *yin*. *Yang* extends the left hand’s two fingers to horizontally cover *yin*’s hand. Place at the southwest, aligning with the shoulder, declare *Kun* Two Returns to become *Dui* Seven *yin*. Extend the left hand’s four *yang* fingers, with the right hand’s three fingers horizontally covering *yin*. Place above the fingers at the west, aligning with the waist, declare *Dui* Seven.

Next command: "Earth reaches the four seasons." Divide four to the four kings of *si* *yang*. With the left hand’s three *yin* fingers horizontal, the right hand’s one finger placed at the southeast, aligning with the shoulder, declare *Xun* Four Returns. Contemplate the five viscera of the Central Palace: *yang* contemplates the kidneys and liver; *yin* contemplates the heart, lungs, and spleen. Each silently declares the Central Official Five. Further command: "Fire is strong, flames rise." Abide in one’s own domain, without dividing positions to complete.

Next command: "Two and four are the shoulders’ *yang*." With the hands together, direct to the *yin* left eyebrow as two, and to the right eyebrow as four. Next command: "Six and eight are the feet’s *yang*." With the right foot direct to *yin*’s left foot as six *yang*; with the left foot direct to *yin*’s right foot as eight. Next command: "Left three, right seven." *Yang* with the left hand, *yin* with the right hand, together direct to *yin*’s left waist as three. *Yang* with the right hand, *yin* with the left hand, together direct to *yin*’s right waist as seven.

Next command: "Wear nine, cover one." *Yang* takes the Upper Primordial’s three; *yin* takes the Upper Primordial’s six. The Lower Primordial’s *yin* and *yang* each take half of one. Further command: "Five resides in the Central Palace, governing the solidity of the abdomen." Together contemplate the five viscera: *yang* the kidneys and liver; *yin* the heart, spleen, and lungs. With the heart mutually harmonize. The Five-Nine Palace positions are complete.

Each declares *Xun*, calls the Gate of Heaven. From *Qian* obtain one, then proceed five. Each declares *Qian* Five, retreat and report five. Proceed another five, each declares *Central Retreat*. Proceed another five, each declares *Xun* Five, retreat and report five. Further declare *Gen* Eight. Raise high and disperse three from *Kun*, then proceed five. Each declares *Gen* Five, retreat and report. Proceed another five, each declares *Kun* Five, retreat and report. Further declare: "Thunder shakes the marsh." From *Dui* obtain two, then proceed five. Each declares *Dui* Five, retreat and report. Proceed another five, each declares *Zhen* Five, retreat and report. Further declare: "*Kan* does not stand alone." From *Li* take four, then proceed five. Each declares *Li* Five, retreat and report. Proceed another five, each declares *Kan* Five, retreat and report. Further declare: "Three and five crisscross, equal and as one."

Forty-five *qi* complete. Measure *jia*’s head at the east *mao*; measure *yi*’s head at the south *wu*, lying down.

---

Sixteenth: Treading the Ji

First: *Yang* Treads the Ji
Below *yin*, lie on the left side outside *yi*. Raise the right hand’s second fingernail. With the left hand’s second and third fingers interlaced in the middle, hold *yi*’s finger. Lift the left foot forward, the right foot horizontally behind. Then lift the left foot three times, rubbing *yi*’s heart, and recite the incantation: "Central *wu ji*, lords and officials of the hundred joints; lords and officials of the four seasons, eight nodes, and twelve hundred offices, assist your minister in passing beneath the Three Bridges." Then lift the left foot from *yi*’s heart, tread *yi*, proceed right to the south, rotate west, turn north, to *yi*’s right flank, eleven steps.

First: *Yin* Treads the Ji
Below *yang*, lie on the right side outside *jia*. Raise the left hand’s second fingernail from *yi*. With the right hand’s second and third fingers interlaced in the middle, hold the *yang* finger. Lift the right foot forward, the left foot horizontally behind. Then lift the right foot three times, rubbing *jia*’s heart, and recite the incantation: "Central *wu ji*, lords and officials of the hundred joints; lords and officials of the four seasons, eight nodes, and twelve hundred offices, assist your handmaiden in passing beneath the Three Bridges." Then lift the right foot from *jia*’s heart, tread *jia*, proceed left to the east, rotate north, turn west, to *jia*’s left flank, eleven steps.

Second: Disperse Steps to Return to *Shen*
Again interlace *yi*’s finger. Lift the left foot forward, the right foot horizontally behind. Then lift the left foot three times, rubbing *yi*’s heart, incantation as before.

Second: Disperse Steps to Return to *Yin*
Again interlace *jia*’s finger. Lift the right foot forward, the left foot horizontally behind. Then lift the right foot three times, rubbing *jia*’s heart, incantation as before.

Third: Disperse Steps to Return to *Shen*
Again interlace *yi*’s finger. Lift the left foot forward, the right foot horizontally behind. Then lift the left foot three times, rubbing *yi*’s heart, incantation as before. *Yang* proceeds, circling three rounds, returns to *yin*. Lie on the left, *yang* rises, grasping the *Kui*. Ascend three *qi*, take three Primordials, swallow three times, complete.

Third: Disperse Steps to Return to *Yin*
Again interlace *jia*’s finger. Lift the right foot forward, the left foot horizontally behind. Then lift the right foot three times, rubbing *jia*’s heart, incantation as before. *Yin* proceeds, circling three rounds, returns to *yang*. Lie on the right, *yang* rises, grasping the *Kui*. Ascend three *qi*, take three Primordials, swallow three times, complete.

*Jia* then rises. With the right hand support *Kunlun*; with the left hand rub the *Niwan*. Rotate left three times, then bring the face down from the left side to the *Niwan*, declaring: "Left, the Supreme Three, take the Upper Primordial." Then tread to the right side, report three times. Again with the left hand support *Kunlun*; with the right hand rub the *Niwan*. Rotate right three times, then bring the face down from the right side to the *Niwan*, declaring: "Right, the Mysterious Elder Three, take the Upper Primordial." Return to the left side, report three times. Again with the right hand support *Kunlun*; with the left hand rub the *Niwan*. First rotate left, then right, then left again, completing three rounds. Bring the face straight down to the *Mingmen*, declaring: "Supreme Three, take the Three Primordials." Then tread to the right side, report three times, then return to the left.

With the right hand support *Kunlun*; with the left hand rub the left Central Primordial below the left breast. Rotate left three times, bring straight down to the *Niwan*, declaring: "Left, the Supreme." Tread to the right, report three times. With the left hand support *Kunlun*; with the right hand rub the right Central Primordial below the right breast. Rotate right three times, bring straight down to the *Niwan*, declaring: "Right, the Mysterious Elder, return to the left," report three times.

With the right hand support *Kunlun*; with the left hand rub the *Niwan*. Rotate left, then right, then left again, completing three rounds. Bring the face straight down to the *Mingmen*, declaring: "Supreme." Tread to the right, report three times, then return to the left. With the right hand support *Kunlun*; with the left hand rub the left side of the *Dantian* below the navel. Rotate left three times, bring straight down to the *Mingmen*, declaring: "Left, the Supreme." Tread to the right, report three times.

With the left hand support *Kunlun*; with the right hand rub the right side of the *Dantian*. Rotate right three times, bring straight down to the *Mingmen*, declaring: "Right, the Mysterious Elder, return to the left," report three times. With the right hand support *Kunlun*; with the left hand rub the *Jianggong*. First rotate left, then right, then left again, completing three rounds. Bring straight down to the *Dantian*, rotate left and right three times downward to the *Mingmen*, declaring: "Supreme." Tread to the right, report three times.

Visualize the Three Qi and return to the left. Lie supine and visualize the spirits: the left, the Qi of the Supreme, true blue-green; the right, the Qi of the Mysterious Elder, true yellow; the center, the Qi of the Supreme, true white, piercing through your body, the Six Jia, the five viscera, and the branches and stems. Left above, right below, encircling the entire body, returning to govern within your lower Dantian, ascending to Kunlun Mountain.

Visualize the One Palace: the Great Clarity’s Primordial Blue-Green Qi, left above and right below, encircling one palace; the Great Simplicity’s White Qi, left above and right below, encircling one palace; the Great Beginning’s Red Qi, left above and right below, encircling one palace; the Great Origin’s Yellow Qi, left above and right below, encircling one palace. The liver’s Qi, true blue-green, left above and right below, encircling one palace; the lungs’ Qi, true white, left above and right below, encircling one palace; the heart’s Qi, true red, left above and right below, encircling one palace; the spleen’s Qi, true yellow, left above and right below, encircling one palace; the kidneys’ Qi, true black, left above and right below, encircling one palace. Each of these palaces is the lower Dantian, wherein the True Person, the Lord, governs. Visualize all the Qi encircling each palace in three layers.

Yin: right above, left below—proceed as above.

Self-Guiding:
Visualize the Qi and spirits to completion. Then, with the hands, guide yourself: with the left hand, trace from the left breast to the foot, declaring "Left, the Supreme" three times and stop. With the right hand, trace from the right breast to the foot, declaring "Right, the Mysterious Elder" three times and stop. Next, with the left hand, trace from the forehead straight downward to the Dantian, the Supreme; the right hand follows. Do this three times, three declarations, then rise upon the *Kui* star, refusing the Three and Five Dragons’ ascent. Again, with the right hand, rub the lower Dantian three times, approach the Gate of Life, open the Golden Gate with the right hand, and insert the Jade Key with the left, placing it upon the Gate of Life. With the left hand supporting Kunlun, and the right hand rubbing the Mingmen horizontally and vertically, declare three times: "Water flows east, clouds return west; yin nurtures yang’s Qi, subtly, subtly, essence and fluid flourish." Ascend to the Master’s Gate. Then, exhale upon the divine male holding the pass, or the divine female opening the door, to harmonize Qi with yin. With Qi, recite the *Yi* incantation: "Yin and yang bestow transformation; the myriad things flourish. Heaven covers, earth bears—may Qi be bestowed upon my body."

Incantation of Jia and Yi:
Seventeenth Jia incantation: "I desire to ride the celestial net and enter earth’s records, the four seasons and five phases, each abiding by their True Person, unshaken. Hold the records and the Five Qi; let the mysterious and the yellow return to my five viscera, naturally generating light."
Yi incantation: "I desire to lie upon earth and uphold heaven, uniting yin and yang, the four seasons and five phases, each abiding by their True Person, unshaken. Hold the records and the Five Qi; let the mysterious and the yellow return to my five viscera, naturally generating light."
With the left hand supporting the Dao Father, recite the incantation: "One Lord before me, two Lords behind me, weaving and removing calamities, adversities, and all misfortunes, causing them all to vanish." Direct left three times, declaring "Left, the Supreme"; direct right three times, declaring "Right, the Mysterious Elder"; direct upward three times, declaring "Center, the Supreme." Declare: "Your servant, so-and-so Jia, humbly seeks passage and transcendence, together upholding the Dao and virtue, beseeching longevity and enduring vision, to become one of the seed people." Direct the center three times, declaring: "Left, the Supreme; right, the Mysterious Elder; the Supreme’s Three Qi together generate your servant’s body, merging into one, named Peach Health, dwelling at the Northern Culmen, called the Cinnabar Child. Clothed in five colors, wearing a great red cap, upon a golden bed and jade couch, with five-colored railings, a canopy of pearls and jade, directly aligned with the Mingmen. Divine males and jade maidens attend on either side. Yang Qi revolves left, yin Qi spirals right, ascending to the Great Clarity, descending to the lowest depths, constantly roaming among the Nine Palaces, the five viscera, and the six bowels. Leading and recording the host of spirits, calling names by the register, they must not flee. Long abide within my body, ascending with me as immortals." Inhale the Qi of life through the nose three times, swallow the yang seven, nine, and eleven times. Declare: "The Dao of heaven proceeds." Declare: "The Dao of earth proceeds." Then enter the Gate of Life, half your head within. Again recite: "Willow Lord, Nü Lord, the myriad spirits live. I desire to shake heaven and move earth; let the Five Lords each attend carefully." Yi incantation: "Willow Lord, Nü Lord, Dantian Palace, I desire to move earth and shake heaven; let the five spirits within my body each firmly advance to the abyss’s depths." Close the mouth, inhale the Qi of life through the nose, exhale through the mouth, click the teeth three times, declaring: "Nine and one are born within." Slightly retreat, half a head’s distance. Jia first proceeds, beginning the Qi of life.

Stems and Branches Count:
In the Jiazi cycle, heaven first generates Bingyin, earth first generates Renshen.
In the Jiaxu cycle, heaven first generates Bingzi, earth first generates Renwu.
In the Jiashen cycle, heaven first generates Bingxu, earth first generates Renchen.
In the Jiawu cycle, heaven first generates Bingshen, earth first generates Renyin.
In the Jiachen cycle, heaven first generates Bingwu, earth first generates Renzi.
In the Jiayin cycle, heaven first generates Bingchen, earth first generates Renxu.
Next, proceed with three, five, seven, nine, then retreat and report; proceed with two, four, six, eight, then retreat and report; proceed with the Five Qi, then retreat and report, swallowing six times.

Proceed with Yi first to initiate the beginning of generation. Next, advance with two, four, six, eight, then retreat and report; proceed with three, five, seven, nine, then retreat and report; proceed with the Three Qi, then retreat and report, drawing in the Upper Primordial Qi three times by swallowing.

Step upon the cyclical marker below, refusing the inverted descent of the Three-Five Dragons. For the first Yin step upon the cyclical marker below the Yang on the right side: lie facing Yang, wearing the Yang upon the head. Raise the Yin with the second finger of the left hand, cross the fingers of the right hand between the second and third fingers to hold the Yang finger, lift the right foot forward, place the left foot horizontally behind, then lift the right foot three times to stroke the heart of Jia while reciting the incantation: *"Central Yellow Wu-Ji, Lords of the Hundred Nodes, Lords of the Four Seasons and Eight Nodes, One Thousand Two Hundred Officials—assist your servant in crossing beneath the Three Bridges."* Then lift the right foot, traverse from the heart of Jia to Jia, turn left to the east, rotate northward, and circle westward to the right flank of Jia, marking eleven traces.

For the first Yang step upon the cyclical marker below the Yin on the left side: lie externally facing Yin, wearing the Yin upon the head. Raise the Yang with the second finger of the right hand, cross the fingers of the left hand between the second and third fingers to hold the Yin finger, lift the left foot forward, place the right foot horizontally behind, then lift the left foot three times to stroke the heart of Yi while reciting the incantation: *"Central Yellow Wu-Ji, Lords of the Hundred Nodes, Lords of the Four Seasons and Eight Nodes, One Thousand Two Hundred Officials—assist your ministers in crossing beneath the Three Bridges."* Then lift the left foot, traverse from the heart of Yi to Yi, turn left to the south, rotate westward, and circle northward to the left flank of Yi, marking eleven traces.

For the second dispersal step returning to Yin, cross the fingers over Jia’s finger, lift the right foot forward, place the left foot horizontally behind, then lift the right foot three times to stroke the heart of Jia while reciting the incantation, tracing as in the first instance. For the second dispersal step returning to Shen, cross the fingers over Yi’s finger, lift the left foot forward, place the right foot horizontally behind, then lift the left foot three times to stroke the heart of Yi while reciting the incantation, tracing as in the first instance. For the third dispersal step returning to Yin, repeat entirely as before. For the third dispersal step returning to Shen, repeat entirely as before.

Passing to the right of the Yang, circle the market three times, then circle the market three times. Returning to Yang from Yin, lie facing Yang to rise, ride the *Kui* upward to conduct the Three Qi, drawing in the Upper Primordial Qi three times by swallowing, then conclude.

Passing to the right of the Yin, circle the perimeter three times, then circle the perimeter three times. Returning to Yin from Yang, lie externally facing Yang to rise, ride the *Kui* upward to conduct the Three Qi, drawing in the Upper Primordial Qi three times by swallowing, then conclude.

For the first Yang step upon the cyclical marker below the Yin on the right side, lie externally facing Yin with the Yin worn upon the head. Raise the Yang with the second finger of the right hand, cross the fingers of the left hand between the second and third fingers to hold the Yin finger, lift the left foot forward, place the right foot horizontally behind, then lift the left foot three times to stroke the heart of Yi while reciting the incantation: *"The Central Womb Perfected Person, three inches and two fen in length, fills the Crimson Palace of Yi, governing the Three Myriads and Six Thousand Spirits of the Life Officials to eternally guard the body of Yi, ascending with Yi as immortals."* Then lift the left foot, traverse from the heart of Yi to the right, proceed southward, rotate westward, and circle northward to the left flank of Yi, marking eleven traces.

For the first Yin step upon the cyclical marker below the Yang on the right side, lie facing Yang with the Yang worn upon the head. Raise the Yin with the second finger of the left hand, cross the fingers of the right hand between the second and third fingers to hold the Yang finger, lift the right foot forward, place the left foot horizontally behind, then lift the right foot three times to stroke the heart of Jia while reciting the incantation: *"The Central Womb Perfected Person, three inches and two fen in length, fills the Blade Palace of Jia, governing the Three Myriads and Six Thousand Spirits of the Life Officials to eternally guard the body of Jia, ascending with Jia as immortals."* Then lift the right foot, traverse from the heart of Jia to the left, proceed eastward, rotate northward, and circle westward to the right flank of Jia, marking eleven traces.

For the second dispersal step returning to Yin, cross the fingers over Jia’s finger again, lift the right foot forward, place the left foot horizontally behind, then lift the right foot three times to stroke the heart of Jia while reciting the incantation, tracing as in the first instance. For the second dispersal step returning to the center, cross the fingers over Yi’s finger again, lift the left foot forward, place the right foot horizontally behind, then lift the left foot three times to stroke the heart of Yi while reciting the incantation, tracing as in the first instance. For the third, repeat entirely as in the second.

Passing to the right of the Yin, circle the perimeter three times. Returning to Yin from Yang, lie facing Yang to rise, ride the *Kui* upward to conduct the Three Qi, drawing in the Upper Primordial Qi three times by swallowing, then conclude. Passing to the right of the Yang, circle the market three times. Returning to Yang from Yin, lie facing Yang to rise, ride the *Kui* upward to conduct the Three Qi, drawing in the Upper Primordial Qi three times by swallowing, then conclude.

The discourse on the Dao of Heaven for Jia is complete; the discourse on the Dao of Earth for Yi is complete. Strike the teeth three times each and recite the incantation: *"Three and Five form the sun and moon, emerging from the profound and entering the obscure—true qi, entering the correct qi, communicating with the spirit qi, spreading the Dao qi. May all malevolent ghosts and thieves be annihilated. Those who gaze upon me shall be blinded; those who listen to me shall be deafened. Whoever dares to plot against me shall suffer the consequences in return."* Then cease with twenty-four breaths, retreat slightly, and recite the incantation of the Supreme Beginning Lord: *"One Lord before me, two Lords behind me, breaking and dispelling disasters, calamities, and all adversities within the Great Yin."* Retreat further to invoke the Supreme Simplicity, then the Supreme Beginning Lord. Exit through the Vermilion Gate, then invert the Dragon to descend on the right side of Yin. With the left hand, support the Kunlun; with the right hand, stroke the Central Primordial. Recite thrice: *"Left, the Utmost Above; right, the Mysterious Elder Supreme."* Draw in the Upper Primordial Qi three times, then stroke the Lower Primordial while reciting: *"Water flows to its end, wood falls to its root, metal is unyielding, fire is fierce, earth reigns over the four seasons."* Then traverse and return to the left. Compose the body and lie flat, crossing the hands over the Great Clarity. Strike the teeth twelve times, then with three, five, seven, nine, swallow the subtle qi through the nose, completing the twenty-four breaths of three, five, seven, and nine.

**Returning the Spirits**

The Three Mysterious Elder Qi, correct and yellow, returns to the spleen of your servants and ministers. The Second Supreme Qi, correct and white, returns to the right kidney of your servants and ministers. The Five Spleen Qi, correct and yellow, right above and left below, returns to the spleen of your servant. The Four Kidney Qi, correct and black, right above and left below, returns to the kidney of your servant. The Yin Official, left above and right below, the Seven Lung Qi, correct and white, right above and left below, returns to the lung of your servant. The Six Heart Qi, correct and red, right above and left below, returns to the heart of your servant. The Supreme Beginning Qi, correct and red, right above and left below, returns to govern the Crimson Palace. The Supreme Clarity Qi, correct and azure, right above and left below, returns to govern the Establishing Loftiness Palace. The Supreme Primordial White Qi, right above and left below, returns to the right kidney of your servant.

The lung is the Canopy Palace, the heart is the Crimson Palace, the liver is the Purple Tenuity Palace, the gallbladder is the Longevity Palace, the spleen is the Hall of Light Palace, the stomach is the Grand Granary Palace, the kidneys are the Twin Envoys. The Five Cities and Twelve Towers, ever accompanying the Red Child, each returns to my palace chambers.

**Royal Qi**
Nineteenth: Rub both hands together until warm, then massage the face and body. In spring, visualize the liver as the Purple Tenuity Palace, its color azure, moist and radiant. Azure qi emerges from the nose, large as a nine-inch mirror, gradually expanding to cover the face, the entire body suffused with azure. In summer, visualize the heart as the Crimson Palace, its color red, moist and radiant. Red qi emerges from the nose, large as an eight-inch mirror, gradually expanding to cover the face, the entire body suffused with red. In autumn, visualize the lung as the Canopy Palace, its color white, moist and radiant. White qi emerges from the nose, large as a six-inch mirror, gradually expanding to cover the face, the entire body suffused with white. In winter, visualize the kidneys as the Twin Envoys, their color black, moist and radiant. Black qi emerges from the nose, large as a five-inch mirror, gradually expanding to cover the face, the entire body suffused with black. During the four seasons when earth reigns, visualize the spleen as the Yellow Court Palace, its color yellow, moist and radiant. Yellow qi emerges from the nose, large as a three-inch mirror, gradually expanding to cover the face, the entire body suffused with yellow.

Then, with the right hand, massage between the breasts, then move the hand downward three times to massage the left and right sides of the cinnabar field, then further downward. Massage below the navel without fixed count. Cross the hands over the head, draw in qi from above, guiding it upward from both feet along the two meridians to the Pass of Origin, then along the three paths of the spine. Yin: right azure, left white, center yellow. Yang: left azure, right white, center yellow. Directly enter the Mud Pill Palace, then reverse the flow. Draw the qi downward: Yin: left azure, right white, center yellow. Yang: right azure, left white, center yellow. From the root of the hair and forehead, along the brows and face, descend through the mouth, nose, and throat, passing through the five viscera down to the feet and ten toes, then return upward as before. Perform three ascents and three descents, returning to store the qi in the lower cinnabar field.

**Infant’s Return**
Twentieth: The infant returns. Yang: bend the left foot beneath the right foot, grasp the left big toe with the right hand and pull. Then turn to the right. Yin: bend the right foot beneath the left foot, grasp the right big toe with the left hand and pull. Then turn to the right, returning to the original position with feet apart.

Yang: first place the right foot against Yin, the left foot against Yin. Then place the right foot against Yang, the left foot against Yang. Again, place the right foot against Yin, the left foot against Yin. Then place the right foot against Yang, the left foot against Yang. With each movement, recite: *"Left, the Utmost Supreme; right, the Mysterious Elder Supreme."* Perform three cycles of advance and return, then stop.

**Severing Death**
Yang: Assume the crane-knee posture. With both hands, stroke from the forehead upward to the feet, then grasp the big toes while seated. Stroke both knees once—this is called "severing the path of death."

Yin: Face the origin of the Primordial Yang. With both hands, gather from the cinnabar field through the Gate of Life, returning to the Jade Father. Press the thumbs and the base of the palms against the face, raise the hands high above the head, then gaze downward toward the Jade Chamber. Lie on the back, slightly raise the head, and gaze toward the origin of the Primordial Yang soaring in the heavens. Soar in the heavens, tread upon the earth, then descend like a butterfly’s wings.

Yang: Press both hands against the yellow earth—this is called "treading upon the earth." Rise from the long kneel, raise the hands high above the head—this is called "soaring in the heavens." Then lower the hands behind—this is called "descending like a butterfly’s wings."

Yang: Cross the left hand over Yin, while the right hand performs the Dragon’s Inversion three times, passing over the head. Men turn left, women turn right, then return to face each other.

Next, traverse the Earthly Net as before. First recite: *"Left, the Utmost Supreme,"* then: *"Right, the Mysterious Elder,"* and finally: *"Supreme."* *"Compassionate Father, Holy Mother, unbind the nets and snares, remove my name from the register of death, inscribe it in the record of life."* Next, release the nets again. First: *"Left, the Utmost Supreme,"* then: *"Right, the Mysterious Elder,"* and finally: *"Supreme."*

*"He who gave me life is Jiazi, Royal Wencheng. My master-father is Kang. He who nurtured me is Jiawu, Minister Wei. My master-mother is Niu. He who gave me life and sustained me serves the Great Dao, alongside my parents."*

Recite: *"Jia-Yin, Dao Father, may you, as your servant, dispel the disasters of the four directions."* Place the right foot on Shen, the left foot in the center. Recite: *"Jia-Shen, Dao Mother, may you, as your servant, disperse the calamities of the four directions."* Yang next treads Mao, Yin next treads Wei, reciting as before. Alternate Zi and Hai, completing a cycle with Yin and Shen. With each cycle, recite: *"He who gave me life is my master-father Kang; she who nurtured me is my master-mother Niu. Next, for *Yi-Mao*, recite the Dao Father’s covenant, cycling through the twelve hours as with *Yin*.

May we traverse the world unhindered, our undertakings accomplished under heaven and earth. **Scripture Title:** *The Yellow Book of Shangqing Rites for Crossing Over*. Author unknown, approximately dating to the Northern and Southern Dynasties. A ritual manual for bedroom cultivation practices in the early Heavenly Master Dao tradition. One scroll. Base text from *Daoist Canon of the Zhengtong Era*, Orthodox Section, Part One.

**The Yellow Book of Shangqing Rites for Crossing Over**

When disciples receive the Dao under a master’s guidance, they must not exceed twenty years of age for the Crossing Over; if they receive the Dao beyond twenty, it is considered an overstepping, and they must bathe, observe prohibitions, and burn incense. Upon entering the oratory (*jing*), they must first report to the master before proceeding. Upon entering and exiting, they bow to the oratory and express gratitude.

**Entering the Oratory**
For the first entry into the oratory, the yang disciple stands at the *yin* position (north), and the yin disciple stands at the *shen* position (west). The one seeking the Crossing Over kneels and says: *"I, a mortal of flesh, am fortunate beyond a thousand generations to have been touched by the transformative power of the Dao. Having sought the Dharma for some time yet remaining uninitiated into the Crossing Over, I bow my head in reverence and take refuge, begging for the gift of life."* They then bow twice.

The master responds: *"Today is auspicious; it is fitting to serve as your bridge."*

The seeker repeats: *"I humbly pray for its fulfillment."*

The master replies: *"I shall make the announcement."* The disciple, overwhelmed by the grace received, bows twice more to the master, who then takes their hand and leads them to face east.

**Visualizing the Officials and Soldiers**
Both stand facing east, the yang on the left and the yin on the right, hands clasped together. The yang disciple interlocks fingers, with the second finger inserted between the yin disciple’s second and third fingers. Each sounds the drum twelve times in their mind, visualizing the Registrar Officials and Envoys, Generals, and Soldiers from the talismans they wear. These figures are adorned in resplendent robes, arrayed in ranks, guarding the disciples front and back, left and right. They are to summon the life-generating *qi* of the four directions to dispel calamities and disperse misfortune, reporting and distinguishing matters with clarity.

This visualization is performed once and then concluded.

**Visualizing the White Qi**
Each visualizes a white *qi* from the cinnabar field (*dantian*), as large as a six-inch mirror, emerging between the eyebrows. It gradually expands, radiating brilliance that illuminates the head above and showers the body below, penetrating to reveal the five viscera, six bowels, nine palaces, twelve chambers, four limbs, five constituents, joints, sinews, vessels, pores, and defensive and constructive *qi*—both exterior and interior—all becoming luminously clear.

This visualization is performed once and then concluded.

**Visualizing the Royal Qi**
Each visualizes the royal *qi* according to the season:
- In spring, visualize the green *qi* of the east nourishing the body, accompanied by red *qi*.
- In summer, visualize the red *qi* of the south, accompanied by yellow *qi*.
- In autumn, visualize the white *qi* of the west, accompanied by black *qi*.
- In winter, visualize the black *qi* of the north, accompanied by green *qi*.
- During the four seasons, visualize the yellow *qi* of the center, accompanied by white *qi*.

Tilt the head back to inhale the *qi* through the nose, then lower the head to swallow it, guiding it down to the cinnabar field. From there, it ascends to the Kunlun (head). This is done three times, with three swallowings, and then concluded.

**Swallowing the Three Palaces**
Each visualizes the life-generating *qi* of the Three Origins descending in pure whiteness, enveloping the body. Tilting the head back, they inhale the life-generating *qi* through the nose and say: *"Palace of Heavenly One, may the life-generating *qi* come to enliven me."* Lowering the head, they swallow it, filling the lower cinnabar field, then guiding it upward to the Mud Pill (head). Following the method of Heaven, Earth, and Water, they recite the incantation and swallow. Tilting the head back again, they inhale the life-generating *qi* of the Three Palaces—Heaven, Earth, and Water—through the nose, saying: *"May the life-generating *qi* of the Three Palaces come together to enliven my body."* Lowering the head, they swallow it, filling the lower cinnabar field, then guiding it upward to the Mud Pill. The life-generating *qi* of the Three Palaces, vast and pure white, covers the body and permeates the five viscera, six bowels, and the twelve branches and trunks.

This visualization is performed once and then concluded.

**Initiating the Rite**

The Eight Generations
The Thirteenth: Unbinding the Hands and the Eight Generations

First: Play of the Dragon and Tiger
Left: the Supreme Center; Right: the Mysterious Elder, the Most High.
“This disciple now delivers the man or woman born under such-and-such a name, that we may together practice the Dao and its virtue, entreating the *yin* and *yang* *qi* of life to be born within this disciple, resolving the Three Officials’ investigations, undoing the net of entanglements, striking the register of death, inscribing the name in the Jade Record of Longevity, transcending the nine calamities, and making this disciple a seed-person of future generations.”

Second: Turning the Pass
Left: the Supreme Center; Right: the Mysterious Elder, the Most High.
The newly emerged Lord Lao, the Supreme Clarity of the Primordial Mystery, the Great Dao of the Boundless Upper Three Heavens.

Third: Dragon and Tiger in Union
Left: the Supreme Center; Right: the Mysterious Elder, the Most High.
Lord Lao, the Most High, the Venerable Lord of the Three *Qi*.

Fourth: Dragon and Tiger in Alignment
Left: the Supreme Center; Right: the Mysterious Elder, the Most High.
The Lord Emperor of the Most High, the Heavenly Emperor, the Venerable Lord.

Fifth: Dragon and Tiger in Motion
Left: the Supreme Center; Right: the Mysterious Elder, the Most High.
The Nine Elders of the Most High, the Lords of the Immortal Capital, the Nine *Qi* Venerable Lords, and the like.

Sixth: Dragon and Tiger in Flux
Take the Upper Primordial: Left, the Supreme Center; Right, the Mysterious Elder, the Most High.
Take the Upper Primordial: the Most High, the myriad layers of the Dao’s *qi*, the twelve hundred Lords Official.

Seventh: Dragon and Tiger in Expansion
Take the Upper Primordial: Left, the Supreme Center; Right, the Mysterious Elder, the Most High.
Take the Upper Primordial: the Most High, the Lord of the Supreme Clarity of the Dao, the Venerable Lord of the Supreme Clarity beneath the Jade Steps.

Eighth: Bowing to the Perfected
Take the Upper Primordial: Left, the Supreme; Center, the Mysterious Elder, the Most High.
Take the Upper Primordial: the Most High, the Heavenly Master, the Lineage Master, the Master of the System, the Female Master.

For the Unbinding of the Middle Primordial’s Twenty-Four *Qi*, all declare:
“Now there is such-and-such a name who entreats for deliverance, that we may together practice the Dao and its virtue, entreating the *yin* and *yang* *qi* of life to be born within this disciple’s body, resolving the Three Officials’ investigations, undoing the net of entanglements, striking the register of death, inscribing the name in the Jade Record of Longevity, transcending the nine calamities, and making this disciple a seed-person of future generations.” All is complete.

Unbinding Knots and Taking Nourishment
The master unbinds the knots of the disciple’s sash and loosens the hair; the one making the declaration also unbinds the knots of the worthy one.

The Fourteenth: Method of Ingesting Life and Expelling Death
Men to the left, women to the right. Hands interlaced, both facing the direction of the king, legs extended in seated posture. With the nose, gently draw in the *qi* of life, lower the head and swallow it. Lie down with eyes closed, and with the mouth gently expel the *qi* of death. Three times lying down, three times sitting—stop.

The Nine Palaces
The Fifteenth: Method of Arranging the Nine Palaces

At the head, *wu*, where Heaven and Earth meet: horizontal lines form *yi*, vertical lines form *jia*.

First: *Zi* Nine
*Yang* proceeds to the Lower Primordial’s four; *yin* proceeds to five. Together call: *Zi* Nine.

Second: *Wu* Nine
*Yang* proceeds to the Upper Primordial’s four; *yin* proceeds to five. Together call: *Wu* Nine.

Third: *Mao* Nine
*Yang*: with the left hand, cover the four fingers horizontally, concealing the *yin*; the right hand’s five fingers above. Combined as nine, placed in the eastern direction. Together declare: *Mao* Nine.

Fourth: *You* Nine
*Yin*: left hand upturned with five fingers extended; *yang*: right hand covering with four fingers, horizontally over the *yin* fingers. Placed in the western direction. Together declare: *You* Nine.

Fifth: Central Nine
Heaven covers, Earth bears. *Yang* contemplates the four viscera: liver, heart, lungs, spleen; *yin* contemplates the five viscera: liver, heart, spleen, lungs, kidneys. Combined as nine, together declare: the Central Five-Nine Position is complete.

Together declare: "Water flows to its end." Divide eight to *chou*. *Yang* uses the second toe of the left foot; *yin* uses the five toes of the right foot. Further, with the right hand’s one finger beside the foot, the *yang* finger covers the *yin* toes to make eight. Place at *chou*, together declare: *Gen* Eight Returns, becomes *Kan* One. *Yin* and *yang* together declare *Kan* One.

Next command: "Wood falls to return to its root." Divide six to *hai*. Pure *yang*: right foot and hand each combine three to make six, covering the *yin* left foot. Place at *hai*, declare *Qian* Six Returns, becomes *Zhen* Three. *Yang* uses the left hand’s one finger to horizontally cover the *yin* right hand’s two fingers. Place together at *mao*, aligning with the waist, declare *Zhen* Three.

Next command: "Metal is firm, fire is strong." Divide two to *wei*. Pure *yin*. *Yang* extends the left hand’s two fingers to horizontally cover *yin*’s hand. Place at the southwest, aligning with the shoulder, declare *Kun* Two Returns to become *Dui* Seven *yin*. Extend the left hand’s four *yang* fingers, with the right hand’s three fingers horizontally covering *yin*. Place above the fingers at the west, aligning with the waist, declare *Dui* Seven.

Next command: "Earth reaches the four seasons." Divide four to the four kings of *si* *yang*. With the left hand’s three *yin* fingers horizontal, the right hand’s one finger placed at the southeast, aligning with the shoulder, declare *Xun* Four Returns. Contemplate the five viscera of the Central Palace: *yang* contemplates the kidneys and liver; *yin* contemplates the heart, lungs, and spleen. Each silently declares the Central Official Five. Further command: "Fire is strong, flames rise." Abide in one’s own domain, without dividing positions to complete.

Next command: "Two and four are the shoulders’ *yang*." With the hands together, direct to the *yin* left eyebrow as two, and to the right eyebrow as four. Next command: "Six and eight are the feet’s *yang*." With the right foot direct to *yin*’s left foot as six *yang*; with the left foot direct to *yin*’s right foot as eight. Next command: "Left three, right seven." *Yang* with the left hand, *yin* with the right hand, together direct to *yin*’s left waist as three. *Yang* with the right hand, *yin* with the left hand, together direct to *yin*’s right waist as seven.

Next command: "Wear nine, cover one." *Yang* takes the Upper Primordial’s three; *yin* takes the Upper Primordial’s six. The Lower Primordial’s *yin* and *yang* each take half of one. Further command: "Five resides in the Central Palace, governing the solidity of the abdomen." Together contemplate the five viscera: *yang* the kidneys and liver; *yin* the heart, spleen, and lungs. With the heart mutually harmonize. The Five-Nine Palace positions are complete.

Each declares *Xun*, calls the Gate of Heaven. From *Qian* obtain one, then proceed five. Each declares *Qian* Five, retreat and report five. Proceed another five, each declares *Central Retreat*. Proceed another five, each declares *Xun* Five, retreat and report five. Further declare *Gen* Eight. Raise high and disperse three from *Kun*, then proceed five. Each declares *Gen* Five, retreat and report. Proceed another five, each declares *Kun* Five, retreat and report. Further declare: "Thunder shakes the marsh." From *Dui* obtain two, then proceed five. Each declares *Dui* Five, retreat and report. Proceed another five, each declares *Zhen* Five, retreat and report. Further declare: "*Kan* does not stand alone." From *Li* take four, then proceed five. Each declares *Li* Five, retreat and report. Proceed another five, each declares *Kan* Five, retreat and report. Further declare: "Three and five crisscross, equal and as one."

Forty-five *qi* complete. Measure *jia*’s head at the east *mao*; measure *yi*’s head at the south *wu*, lying down.

---

Sixteenth: Treading the Ji

First: *Yang* Treads the Ji
Below *yin*, lie on the left side outside *yi*. Raise the right hand’s second fingernail. With the left hand’s second and third fingers interlaced in the middle, hold *yi*’s finger. Lift the left foot forward, the right foot horizontally behind. Then lift the left foot three times, rubbing *yi*’s heart, and recite the incantation: "Central *wu ji*, lords and officials of the hundred joints; lords and officials of the four seasons, eight nodes, and twelve hundred offices, assist your minister in passing beneath the Three Bridges." Then lift the left foot from *yi*’s heart, tread *yi*, proceed right to the south, rotate west, turn north, to *yi*’s right flank, eleven steps.

First: *Yin* Treads the Ji
Below *yang*, lie on the right side outside *jia*. Raise the left hand’s second fingernail from *yi*. With the right hand’s second and third fingers interlaced in the middle, hold the *yang* finger. Lift the right foot forward, the left foot horizontally behind. Then lift the right foot three times, rubbing *jia*’s heart, and recite the incantation: "Central *wu ji*, lords and officials of the hundred joints; lords and officials of the four seasons, eight nodes, and twelve hundred offices, assist your handmaiden in passing beneath the Three Bridges." Then lift the right foot from *jia*’s heart, tread *jia*, proceed left to the east, rotate north, turn west, to *jia*’s left flank, eleven steps.

Second: Disperse Steps to Return to *Shen*
Again interlace *yi*’s finger. Lift the left foot forward, the right foot horizontally behind. Then lift the left foot three times, rubbing *yi*’s heart, incantation as before.

Second: Disperse Steps to Return to *Yin*
Again interlace *jia*’s finger. Lift the right foot forward, the left foot horizontally behind. Then lift the right foot three times, rubbing *jia*’s heart, incantation as before.

Third: Disperse Steps to Return to *Shen*
Again interlace *yi*’s finger. Lift the left foot forward, the right foot horizontally behind. Then lift the left foot three times, rubbing *yi*’s heart, incantation as before. *Yang* proceeds, circling three rounds, returns to *yin*. Lie on the left, *yang* rises, grasping the *Kui*. Ascend three *qi*, take three Primordials, swallow three times, complete.

Third: Disperse Steps to Return to *Yin*
Again interlace *jia*’s finger. Lift the right foot forward, the left foot horizontally behind. Then lift the right foot three times, rubbing *jia*’s heart, incantation as before. *Yin* proceeds, circling three rounds, returns to *yang*. Lie on the right, *yang* rises, grasping the *Kui*. Ascend three *qi*, take three Primordials, swallow three times, complete.

*Jia* then rises. With the right hand support *Kunlun*; with the left hand rub the *Niwan*. Rotate left three times, then bring the face down from the left side to the *Niwan*, declaring: "Left, the Supreme Three, take the Upper Primordial." Then tread to the right side, report three times. Again with the left hand support *Kunlun*; with the right hand rub the *Niwan*. Rotate right three times, then bring the face down from the right side to the *Niwan*, declaring: "Right, the Mysterious Elder Three, take the Upper Primordial." Return to the left side, report three times. Again with the right hand support *Kunlun*; with the left hand rub the *Niwan*. First rotate left, then right, then left again, completing three rounds. Bring the face straight down to the *Mingmen*, declaring: "Supreme Three, take the Three Primordials." Then tread to the right side, report three times, then return to the left.

With the right hand support *Kunlun*; with the left hand rub the left Central Primordial below the left breast. Rotate left three times, bring straight down to the *Niwan*, declaring: "Left, the Supreme." Tread to the right, report three times. With the left hand support *Kunlun*; with the right hand rub the right Central Primordial below the right breast. Rotate right three times, bring straight down to the *Niwan*, declaring: "Right, the Mysterious Elder, return to the left," report three times.

With the right hand support *Kunlun*; with the left hand rub the *Niwan*. Rotate left, then right, then left again, completing three rounds. Bring the face straight down to the *Mingmen*, declaring: "Supreme." Tread to the right, report three times, then return to the left. With the right hand support *Kunlun*; with the left hand rub the left side of the *Dantian* below the navel. Rotate left three times, bring straight down to the *Mingmen*, declaring: "Left, the Supreme." Tread to the right, report three times.

With the left hand support *Kunlun*; with the right hand rub the right side of the *Dantian*. Rotate right three times, bring straight down to the *Mingmen*, declaring: "Right, the Mysterious Elder, return to the left," report three times. With the right hand support *Kunlun*; with the left hand rub the *Jianggong*. First rotate left, then right, then left again, completing three rounds. Bring straight down to the *Dantian*, rotate left and right three times downward to the *Mingmen*, declaring: "Supreme." Tread to the right, report three times.

Lie supine and visualize the spirits: the left, the Qi of the Supreme, true blue-green; the right, the Qi of the Mysterious Elder, true yellow; the center, the Qi of the Supreme, true white, piercing through your body, the Six Jia, the five viscera, and the branches and stems. Left above, right below, encircling the entire body, returning to govern within your lower Dantian, ascending to Kunlun Mountain.

Visualize the One Palace: the Great Clarity’s Primordial Blue-Green Qi, left above and right below, encircling one palace; the Great Simplicity’s White Qi, left above and right below, encircling one palace; the Great Beginning’s Red Qi, left above and right below, encircling one palace; the Great Origin’s Yellow Qi, left above and right below, encircling one palace. The liver’s Qi, true blue-green, left above and right below, encircling one palace; the lungs’ Qi, true white, left above and right below, encircling one palace; the heart’s Qi, true red, left above and right below, encircling one palace; the spleen’s Qi, true yellow, left above and right below, encircling one palace; the kidneys’ Qi, true black, left above and right below, encircling one palace. Each of these palaces is the lower Dantian, wherein the True Person, the Lord, governs. Visualize all the Qi encircling each palace in three layers.

Yin: right above, left below—proceed as above.

Self-Guiding:
Visualize the Qi and spirits to completion. Then, with the hands, guide yourself: with the left hand, trace from the left breast to the foot, declaring "Left, the Supreme" three times and stop. With the right hand, trace from the right breast to the foot, declaring "Right, the Mysterious Elder" three times and stop. Next, with the left hand, trace from the forehead straight downward to the Dantian, the Supreme; the right hand follows. Do this three times, three declarations, then rise upon the *Kui* star, refusing the Three and Five Dragons’ ascent. Again, with the right hand, rub the lower Dantian three times, approach the Gate of Life, open the Golden Gate with the right hand, and insert the Jade Key with the left, placing it upon the Gate of Life. With the left hand supporting Kunlun, and the right hand rubbing the Mingmen horizontally and vertically, declare three times: "Water flows east, clouds return west; yin nurtures yang’s Qi, subtly, subtly, essence and fluid flourish." Ascend to the Master’s Gate. Then, exhale upon the divine male holding the pass, or the divine female opening the door, to harmonize Qi with yin. With Qi, recite the *Yi* incantation: "Yin and yang bestow transformation; the myriad things flourish. Heaven covers, earth bears—may Qi be bestowed upon my body."

Incantation of Jia and Yi:
Seventeenth Jia incantation: "I desire to ride the celestial net and enter earth’s records, the four seasons and five phases, each abiding by their True Person, unshaken. Hold the records and the Five Qi; let the mysterious and the yellow return to my five viscera, naturally generating light."
Yi incantation: "I desire to lie upon earth and uphold heaven, uniting yin and yang, the four seasons and five phases, each abiding by their True Person, unshaken. Hold the records and the Five Qi; let the mysterious and the yellow return to my five viscera, naturally generating light."
With the left hand supporting the Dao Father, recite the incantation: "One Lord before me, two Lords behind me, weaving and removing calamities, adversities, and all misfortunes, causing them all to vanish." Direct left three times, declaring "Left, the Supreme"; direct right three times, declaring "Right, the Mysterious Elder"; direct upward three times, declaring "Center, the Supreme." Declare: "Your servant, so-and-so Jia, humbly seeks passage and transcendence, together upholding the Dao and virtue, beseeching longevity and enduring vision, to become one of the seed people." Direct the center three times, declaring: "Left, the Supreme; right, the Mysterious Elder; the Supreme’s Three Qi together generate your servant’s body, merging into one, named Peach Health, dwelling at the Northern Culmen, called the Cinnabar Child. Clothed in five colors, wearing a great red cap, upon a golden bed and jade couch, with five-colored railings, a canopy of pearls and jade, directly aligned with the Mingmen. Divine males and jade maidens attend on either side. Yang Qi revolves left, yin Qi spirals right, ascending to the Great Clarity, descending to the lowest depths, constantly roaming among the Nine Palaces, the five viscera, and the six bowels. Leading and recording the host of spirits, calling names by the register, they must not flee. Long abide within my body, ascending with me as immortals." Inhale the Qi of life through the nose three times, swallow the yang seven, nine, and eleven times. Declare: "The Dao of heaven proceeds." Declare: "The Dao of earth proceeds." Then enter the Gate of Life, half your head within. Again recite: "Willow Lord, Nü Lord, the myriad spirits live. I desire to shake heaven and move earth; let the Five Lords each attend carefully." Yi incantation: "Willow Lord, Nü Lord, Dantian Palace, I desire to move earth and shake heaven; let the five spirits within my body each firmly advance to the abyss’s depths." Close the mouth, inhale the Qi of life through the nose, exhale through the mouth, click the teeth three times, declaring: "Nine and one are born within." Slightly retreat, half a head’s distance. Jia first proceeds, beginning the Qi of life.

Stems and Branches Count:
In the Jiazi cycle, heaven first generates Bingyin, earth first generates Renshen.
In the Jiaxu cycle, heaven first generates Bingzi, earth first generates Renwu.
In the Jiashen cycle, heaven first generates Bingxu, earth first generates Renchen.
In the Jiawu cycle, heaven first generates Bingshen, earth first generates Renyin.
In the Jiachen cycle, heaven first generates Bingwu, earth first generates Renzi.
In the Jiayin cycle, heaven first generates Bingchen, earth first generates Renxu.
Next, proceed with three, five, seven, nine, then retreat and report; proceed with two, four, six, eight, then retreat and report; proceed with the Five Qi, then retreat and report, swallowing six times.

chunks.original_text: 度乙先行始生，次二四六八退报，又行三五七九退报，又行三气退报，取上元气三咽之。 便蹑纪下不受三五龙倒下 第一阴蹑纪下阳右边，卧阳卧戴，左手第二指阴起，以右手第二三指中间相叉持阳指，举右足於前，左足横后，因举右足三摩甲心咒，中黄戊己百节君吏，四时八节千二百官君吏，辅妾过某三桥之下，因举右足，从甲心度甲，左东行北旋，西转至甲右胁十一迹。 第一阳蹑纪下阴左边，外阴卧戴，右手第二指阳起，以左手第二三指中问相叉持阴指，举左足於前； 右足横后，因举左足三摩乙心咒，中黄戊己百节君吏，四时八节千二百官君吏，辅臣过某三桥之下，因举左足，从乙心度乙，左南行西旋，北转至乙左胁令成十一迹。 第二散步还寅叉甲指，举右足於前，左足横后，因举右足三摩甲心咒，度迹如第一。 第二散步还申叉乙指，举左足於前，右足横后，因举左足三摩乙心咒，度迹如第一。 第三散步还寅，悉复如前。 第三散步还申，悉复如前。 右过阳三绕周市行三绕市，阴还阳右卧阳起，乘魁上行三炁，取上元三咽毕。 右过阴三绕周匝行三绕匝，阳还阴左外阳因起，乘魁上行三炁，取上元三咽毕。 第一阳蹑纪下阴右边阴外戴，右手第二指阳起，以左手第二三指中间相叉持阴指举，左足於前，右足横后，因举左足三摩乙心咒曰，中胎真人长三寸二分，填乙绛宫，摄录生官三万六千神长守乙体，与乙俱仙，因举左足从乙心度右，南行西旋北转，至乙左胁，令成十一迹。 第一阴蹑纪下阳右边阳卧戴，左手第二指阴起，以右手第二三指中间相叉持阳指举，右足於前，左足横复，因举右足三摩甲心咒曰，中胎真人长三寸二分，填甲锋宫，摄录生官三万六千神长守甲体，与甲俱仙，因举右足从甲心度左，东行北旋西转，至甲右胁，令成十一迹。 第二散步还寅更叉甲指，举右足於前，左足横后，因举右足三摩甲心咒迹如第一。 第二散步还中更叉乙指，举左足於前，右足横后，因举左足三摩乙心咒迹如第一。 第三悉复如第二 右过阴三绕周匝阳还阴，左卧阳因起，乘魁上行三气，取上元三咽毕。 右过阳三绕周市阴还阳，右卧阳因起，乘魁上行三气，取上元三咽毕。 甲言天道毕，乙言地道毕，悉三叩齿，各咒曰三五成日月，出窈窈入冥冥真气，入正气，通神气，布道气，行奸邪鬼贼皆消亡，视我者盲，听我者聋，敢有谋图我者反受其殃，便二十四息止小退言太初君令半首咒曰，一君在吾前，二君在吾后，为吾破除灾害恶逆，一切皆绝太阴中，又小退念太素，又退太始君，出朱门便龙倒下阴右边，以左手扶昆仑，右手摩中元，三言左无上，右玄老太上，三取上元气，摩下元咒曰，水流归末，木落归本，金刚火强，土王四季、因度还左，各正身平卧，叉手过泰清，十二叩齿，三五七九，咽鼻微微纳生气，至三五七九二十四气都毕。 还神 第十八便思，还诸神阴阳，各以两手交额上，各思解气无上气正青，还臣妾左肾中。
